ShetranInput:
Neckar4subPersoDWD sub4_E_Perso_DWD dem_avg_4_sub.asc This is used to caculate the elevations of the grid squares dem_min_4_sub.asc This is used to caculate the location and elevations of the river channels. If it is not avilable the mean dem can be used here. sub4_E.asc landcover_4_sub.asc Vegetation / land-use map. The number of categories must correspond to those in Vegetation details soil_4_sub.asc Soil category map. the number of categories must correspond to those in Soil details lake_4_sub.asc No lakes grids_order_4_sub.txt Spatial distibution of precipitation stations grids_order_4_sub_etp.txt Spatial distibution of PE stations Veg Type #, Vegetation Type, Canopy storage capacity (mm), Leaf area index, Maximum rooting depth(m), AE/PE at field capacity 1, Arable, 1.5, 1, 0.8, 0.6, 1.5 2, BareGround, 0, 0, 0.1, 0.4, 2.0 3, Grass, 1.5, 1, 1.0, 0.6, 1.0 4, DeciduousForest, 5, 1, 1.6, 1.0, 0.5 5, EvergreenForest, 5, 1, 2.0, 1.0, 0.5 6, Shrub, 1.5, 1, 1.0, 0.4, 1.0 7, Urban, 0.3, 0.3, 0.5, 0.4, 5.0
Soil Number,Soil Type, Saturated Water Content, Residual Water Content, Saturated Conductivity (m/day), vanGenuchten- alpha (cm-1), vanGenuchten-n 1,Clay(clay>60%), 0.544, 0.326, 0.014, 0.0046, 1.44 2,SiltyClay(clay>40%), 0.529, 0.212, 0.019, 0.00654, 1.531 3,Clayloam(clay>30%), 0.489, 0.153, 0.055, 0.0093, 1.65 4,Siltloam(18%clay65%sand), 0.434, 0.16, 0.317, 0.0083, 1.587 5,SandyClay(40%clay52%sand), 0.499, 0.233, 0.029, 0.0107, 1.879 6,Sandloam(sand>65%), 0.412, 0.098, 0.622, 0.0144, 1.736
Soil Category, Soil Layer, Soil Type, Depth at base of layer (m) 1, 1, 2, 0.1 1, 2, 3, 0.3 1, 3, 4, 0.43 1, 4, 5, 0.6 1, 5, 6, 1.0 2, 1, 2, 0.12 2, 2, 3, 0.3 2, 3, 4, 0.6 3, 1, 3, 0.05 3, 2, 4, 0.3 3, 3, 5, 0.55 3, 4, 6, 1.1 4, 1, 3, 0.25 4, 2, 4, 0.4 4, 3, 5, 0.7 4, 4, 6, 1.5 5, 1, 2, 0.04 5, 2, 3, 0.12 5, 3, 4, 0.18 5, 4, 5, 0.25 5, 5, 6, 1.0 6, 1, 4, 0.2 6, 2, 5, 0.8 6, 3, 6, 1.2 7, 1, 3, 0.2 7, 2, 4, 0.8 7, 3, 5, 1.2 8, 1, 3, 0.3 8, 2, 4, 0.5 8, 3, 5, 0.9 9, 1, 3, 0.2 9, 2, 4, 0.7 9, 3, 5, 1.2 10, 1, 3, 0.2 10, 2, 4, 0.6 10, 3, 5, 1.0 11, 1, 3, 0.2 11, 2, 4, 0.4 11, 3, 5, 0.7 11, 4, 6, 1.9
0 Initial water table depth below ground. T_DWD_out_2017_2019.csv Precipitation time series. Units are in mm in the timestep length in PrecipitationTimeStep. In this case mmm/day 1 Timestep in hours data_etp_2017_2019_h.csv PE time series. Units are in mm in the timestep length in EvaporationTimeStep. In this case mmm/day 1 Timestep in hours data_TXK_MN004_kr_2017_2019_h.csv data_TNK_MN004_kr_2017_2019_h.csv 01 01 2017 30 12 2018 1 Number of upstream grid squares needed to produce a river channel. A larger number will have fewer river channels 2 The standard and minimum value is 2 if there are numerical problems with error 1060 this can be increased 0.5 This depends on the grid size and how steep the catchment is. A value of 1 is a sensible starting point but more gently sloping catchments it can be reduced. 1.0 This is the standard Shetran timestep it is autmatically reduced in rain. The standard value is 1 hour. The maximum allowed value is 2 hours 0.05 speed of increase in timestep after rainfall back to the standard timestep. The standard value is 0.05. If if there are numerical problems with error 1060 it can be reduced to 0.01 but the simulation will take longer. 1.0 This should be the same as the measured discharge 0.0002 Units = mm s-1 C-1
